result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Becker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply 78 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution (payable to Denny's) is to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Defendant not to be involved in any gambling.
Not to go to any gambling sites or casinos.
To be involved in any gambling treatment and follow through the Agent deems appropriate.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the Denny's listed in the Criminal Complaint.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Case 16CF291 is dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.  STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael R Becker in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Counts 3 - 12 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
 78 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 2.5  Years
Concurrent to:  count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant not to be involved in any gambling.
Not to go to any gambling sites or casinos.
To be involved in any gambling treatment and follow through the agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Dennys listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.

RESTITUTION:  $7,336.93 (to be paid to the Dennys listed in the criminal complaint - To be paid before costs/fines)
Costs:  $268
DNA (Sample has already been provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.   

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. 





Count 2:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
78 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.


Term of Probation: 2.5 Years.
Concurrent to: count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
